title: Salmon Cookies
body: Salmon Cookies is a website created to model the business needs of a fictional chain which sells -- you guessed it! -- salmon cookies. It appears that demand is at an all-time high for these cookies, and the owners wanted a website that would not only please their customers, but also provide them with important data regarding cookie sales. They also wanted us to specifically use all of their images.

title: First Intro Site
body: This was my first project at Code Fellows. We were asked to create a website about ourselves, including a bit of work history and a fun quiz to help others get to know me. I chose a picture of me from the last time I was in India, as I love the color of the pants I was wearing and wanted to experiment with using gradients. I cringe looking at it now, but it was a great learning experience!

title: BusMall
body:
For BusMall, we were asked to create a tool for the marketing team of a fictional business similar to SkyMall (the airplane magazine that sells high-end products). The idea was to see which products were most likely to sell based on having users choose which products they would buy of a given set. The products were always going to be presented in a set of three, with no duplicate images among that set, and the same product was not permitted to appear in two consecutive sets.

We would then store the data for each product locally, and populate a chart based on this information once the user completed choosing among 25 sets. We used chart.js to populate the chart, which was the first time I got to play around with such a library. I loved it!

title: 72RPM Game
body: This was the first group project I worked on. I was responsible for building out the game logic according to a spec set by the rest of the group. I learned a lot in this project, especially getting used to constantly refactoring code and switching up the logic on command. It was a great experience.
